intro: Calceolaria argentea, commonly known as the silver calceolaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and showy, hooded flowers that resemble small cups. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist conditions. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is prized for its ornamental value in gardens. Calceolaria argentea prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays.
